item.title: Automating the Import and Export of Kibana Saved Objects
item.description:
Introduction

Kibana is an open-source data visualization and exploration tool used for log and time-series analytics, application monitoring, and operational intelligence use cases. It offers powerful and easy-to-use features that allow users to visualize data from Elasticsearch in various formats such as charts, tables, and maps.

While Kibana offers a robust user interface for managing many tasks, certain operations can become tedious and time-consuming when done manually, especially for operations teams managing large and complex environments. One such operation is the migration of Kibana spaces and objects between environmentsâ€”a task that can be critical in scenarios where clients cannot utilize the snapshot/restore functionality provided by Elasticsearch.
